data.label:
Lucita Azaro

"Let me start by saying that I've made good progress into who may be responsible."

Lucita Azaro

"Unfortunately, yes. There were several individuals I initially found highly suspicious."

Player_Romus

"Then let's hear it."

Player_Romus

"Well, go on. Spit it out."

Player_Romus

"Who?"

Narrator

Lucita discreetly glanced around as if making sure there was no one else with us.

Player_Romus

"You're conveniently forgetting yourself."

Player_Romus

"I hope you've narrowed it down from there."

Player_Romus

"My mother? How dare you insinuate such an awful thing."

Lucita Azaro

"You wouldn't have asked me to investigate if you thought I was guilty."

Player_Romus

"Well then, go on. Explain your reasoning."

Player_Romus

"Alright, let's go down the list."

Player_Romus

"I hope you're armed with substantial evidence."

Lucita Azaro

"As a matter of fact, I have."

Lucita Azaro

"I meant no offense. You told me to investigate everyone who was at the palace at the time."

Lucita Azaro

"With whom should I begin?"

Narrator

I nodded, interest piqued.

Player_Romus

"Intriguing... Please go on."

Player_Romus

"Leaving his room? This is news to me."

Player_Romus

"I seriously find that hard to believe."

Player_Romus

"If your account is accurate, I am truly shocked."

Player_Romus

"I need to know everything you've discovered regarding my mother's whereabouts on the night of my father passing."

Player_Romus

"Let's hear why you suspect Titus."

Player_Romus

"Well, that's good right?"

Player_Romus

"Dastnurist? Are you absolutely sure?"

Player_Romus

"If this is your idea of a joke, I'm not laughing."

Player_Romus

"Well, they must have been mistaken."

Player_Romus

"I find this accusation hard to believe. Titus has been nothing but loyal from day one."

Lucita Azaro

"On the night of King Valero's death, Captain Gordion was charged with guarding his chambers."

Player_Romus

"He wasn't at his post? That seems slightly irregular."

Player_Romus

"Captain Gordion not being at his post seems rather unusual. However, it wasn't strange for my father to receive visitations at odd hours."

Player_Romus

"Not in the castle? Then where the hell was she?"

Player_Romus

"I suppose my mother has her own share of secrets, just like any other person. Who would have thought?"

Player_Romus

"I don't see anything unusual about that. He's often taken it upon himself to personally oversee my security."

Player_Romus

"Okay, I'm listening."

Player_Romus

"Yes. And?"

Player_Romus

"This only confirms my suspicions that he can't be trusted."

Player_Romus

"This is troubling news, Lucita. I've always taken Titus to be a loyal protector."

Player_Romus

"As for Sal, I don't believe there's any inclining on malcontent in him. Your witnesses must have confused him for someone else."

Player_Romus

"So tell me about what makes Sal a suspect in your mind? I'm having a hard time wrapping my head around it."

Player_Romus

"But what I'm most concerned with is where Sal fits into all of this."

Player_Romus

"Concerning Sal, I'm curious to hear more about why you suspect him. As a holy man, he doesn't fit the murdering type."

Player_Romus

"However, I can't say the same for Sal."

Player_Romus

"Sal, on the other hand, is another story. I've suspected his motivations ever since I took the throne. If what you're saying is true, it only confirms my original misgivings."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, of course. It actually relates to Wiseman Ignacius as well."

Lucita Azaro

"As you already know, on the night of your father's death, Grand Wisman Sal was seen entering his chamber."

Lucita Azaro

"I'm merely presenting the facts, Your Majesty. It's unusual for someone in Pabel's position to be absent for such a long period."

Player_Romus

"Unaccounted for? Please explain."

Lucita Azaro

"During the time leading up to Valero's death, there was a significant period when he couldn't be accounted for."

Player_Romus

"That sounds very un-Pabel."

Player_Romus

"This news is troubling, to say the least. But we must consider the possibility that even the most loyal individuals can make mistakes or be influenced by circumstances."

Player_Romus

"For his sake, I'm relieved, but that puts us no closer to finding the culprit."

Narrator

Lucita gave a slight bow and moved toward the door. But before she left, she turned.

Narrator

Lucita bowed and bid me good day before she turned and left my side.

Player_Romus

"Is that all? That doesn't prove he had a hand in anything, let alone make him public enemy number one."

Player_Romus

"You were right to come to me, however, we mustn't rely on hearsay. We need cold hard facts before jumping to conclusions."

Player_Romus

"So I was correct in believing my father's untimely end was no accident."

Player_Romus

"So quickly? Tell me more."

Player_Romus

"An eyewitness? How did you discover this?"

Player_Romus

"If this information is inaccurate in any way, there will  be hell to pay."

Player_Romus

"This is a lot to process. I'm having a hard time believing any of it."

Player_Romus

"My God... A Dastnurist service? How can this be?"

Lucita Azaro

"Your Majesty, I have reason to believe that Grand Wiseman Sal may have had a motive to harm King Valero."

Lucita Azaro

"As you know, King Valero's decision to suppress the minority religions in our kingdom was met with resistance by many -- including the Grand Wiseman."

Player_Romus

"I've had my share of disagreements with my father, regarding his religious policies, but I never imagined it could lead to such an outcome."

Player_Romus

"Do you have any concrete evidence linking Sal to the crime? Because right now, your argument feels a bit thin."

Player_Romus

"Seems plausible. Do you have any concrete evidence linking Sal to the crime?"

Player_Romus

"I still have my doubts about your conclusions on the Grand Wiseman. As far as I can tell, his actions were honorable and virtuous. Nevertheless, I will keep an open mind."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, however, it's unusual for someone in Pabel's position to remain absent for an extended duration."

Lucita Azaro

"He has access to the palace's internal operations, which made him a noteworthy figure in my inquiry."

Lucita Azaro

"He possesses knowledge of the palace's internal workings, which rendered him a significant figure in my investigation."

Player_Romus

"That is odd. Please continue."

Player_Romus

"Tread carefully. You're speaking of one of the most highly respected men in this kingdom!"

Lucita Azaro

"Of course. I meant no offense."

Lucita Azaro

"The evidence is circumstantial, but I believe I can uncover more conclusive information with additional inquiries into him."

Player_Romus

"Continue your investigation into Titus. But do so discreetly. He has eyes and ears everywhere."

Player_Romus

"This investigation has gone as far as it can go. Cease all further efforts, effective immediately."

Player_Romus

"I hate to say it, but keep looking into Sal. There's more to the Wiseman than he's letting on."

Lucita Azaro

"Very good, Your Majesty. Rest assured, I will get to the bottom of this as soon as possible."

Lucita Azaro

"Very well. But for the record, I still believe their actions warrant further scrutiny, but I won't press the issue further."

Player_Romus

"But what I find most concerning is Sal's role in this drama."

Player_Romus

"Sal, on the other hand, is another story. I've suspected his motivations ever since I took the throne. If what you're saying is true, it only confirms my original misgivings."

Suspect Sal Hub

Suspect Sal Hub

Player_Romus

"I had a funny feeling about that Golden Guardsman. There was something about him that never sat right with me."

Player_Romus

"If what you're saying is true, this angers me to no end. I can't believe I trusted him."

Narrator

If Titus' apprehensions of misconduct were indeed accurate, particularly involving someone with whom I'd shared an intimate connection, it raised a significant question... who in my inner circle could I rely on?

Lucita Azaro

"Investigation aside... so about that proper date you owe me."

Narrator

I assured myself that my decision to investigate Lucita was justified.

Player_Romus

"I understand your concern, but I believe there must rational explanations to your alleged transgressions. I'm confident none of them had anything to do with my father's death."

Player_Romus

"Duly noted."

Player_Romus

"For the record, I don't."

Player_Romus

"Though, I pray your suspicions don't turn out to be true."

Player_Romus

"I pray that you conclude he's innocent of all of this."

Investigate Hub

Investigate Hub

Narrator

And if Lucita's suspicions of wrongdoings turned out to be true -- especially from someone whose sole purpose was to protect the king -- it begged the question...  who could I trust?

Narrator

And if my suspicions of wrongdoings turned out to be true -- especially for a man of faith -- it begged the question...  who could I trust?

Narrator

I assured myself that my decision to stop investigating was justified.

Titus Gordion

"Very good, Your Majesty. I'll work diligently to uncover the truth as soon as I can."

Titus Gordion

"Very well. I still believe their actions require closer examination, but I won't push the matter any further."

Titus Gordion

"Consider it handled."

Narrator

Titus bowed and bid me good day before he turned and left.

Titus Gordion

"Allow me to begin by stating that I've made significant headway in identifying potential culprits."

Titus Gordion

"Regrettably, yes. Multiple individuals raised strong suspicions."

Titus Gordion

"My initial list of suspects comprised five individuals. Lucita Azaro, Grand Wiseman Ignacius, your butler, your uncle, and your mother."

Narrator

Titus discreetly looked around, as if making sure there was no one else with us.

Titus Gordion

"Yes, sir. That appears to be the case. And I believe I've narrowed it down to a handful of possible suspects."

Titus Gordion

"I've pinpointed several individuals who initially aroused considerable suspicion and warranted closer examination."

Lucita Azaro

"She is only human after all. That said, you might be shocked to learn the nature of her secret outing."

Lucita Azaro

"Not so fast, Your Majesty. This may come as a shock, but as it happens, she was attending a religious service just outside the capital."

Lucita Azaro

"Absolutely. We managed to find credible eyewitnesses who were present at the Dastnurist archsanctuary that night who can verify it."

Lucita Azaro

"I assure you, it's no joke. We managed to find credible eyewitnesses who were present at the Dastnurist archsanctuary that very night who can verify it."

Lucita Azaro

"It's not my place to speculate on that, Your Majesty. All I know is that multiple eyewitnesses who were present at the Dastnurist archsanctuary that night can verify it."

Player_Romus

"Dastnurity aside, it's a relief to hear she's no longer a suspect."

Player_Romus

"Sure, but it still doesn't excuse her attendance at a Dastnurist event! It's an affront to our faith!"

Player_Romus

"Your slow approach to sharing crucial information is frustrating. Get to the point faster next time."

Player_Romus

"Then I suppose I'll have to find another suspect."

Lucita Azaro

"Needless to say, this proves your mother had an alibi, and had nothing to do with your father's death."

Titus Gordion

"Needless to say, this establishes an alibi for your mother, and she had no involvement in your father's death."

Lucita Azaro

"Of all the individuals I've been looking into, your Uncle Hugo stands out the most."

Lucita Azaro

"There are witnesses who claim they saw Hugo leaving your father's room on the night of his death, just moments before his body was discovered."

Lucita Azaro

"Believe me, I was just as surprised as you are."

Lucita Azaro

"Believe it or not, but facts are facts."

Lucita Azaro

"Forgive me for my bluntness, but what more do you need? We must ascertain the reason for his presence."

Lucita Azaro

"And what's most curious is that, according to witnesses, he let Grand Wiseman Ignacius enter your father's chambers without any opposition."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, but what is most unusual is that multiple witnesses have claimed to have seen Grand Wiseman Ignacius enter the king's quarters unchallenged."

Lucita Azaro

"But that's not what I found most interesting..."

Lucita Azaro

"It is, which raises questions about his loyalty and the circumstances surrounding the king's demise."

Lucita Azaro

"I cannot say for certain, but the fact that such a significant breach in protocol occurred on Captain Gordion's watch is deeply concerning."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, but the timing can't be a coincidence."

Lucita Azaro

"Your admiration of Captain Gordion is notable, but our duty sometimes requires us to question even the most loyal among us."

Lucita Azaro

"I understand your reservations, but my duty is to uncover the truth, no matter how uncomfortable it may be."

Lucita Azaro

"I understand. But my responsibility is to unveil the truth, even if it proves to be unsettling."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes. We proceed with caution."

Lucita Azaro

"I've had my reservations about him as well. It's always best to trust your instincts in such matters."

Lucita Azaro

"I share your frustration. If these allegations hold up, it's a betrayal that none of us could have foreseen."

Player_Romus

"As for Sal, I still don't believe there's any inclining on malcontent in him. It doesn't make any sense."

Lucita Azaro

"I hope so, but that's why we mustn't leave any stone unturned."

Lucita Azaro

"That's why it's important to get to the bottom of this."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes. His action deserves a great deal of scrutiny."

Lucita Azaro

"His actions are indeed suspicious."

Lucita Azaro

"Gladly."

Lucita Azaro

"Happy to."

Lucita Azaro

"A possibility, for sure, but I assure you that my witnesses are reliable."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes. His action deserves a great deal of scrutiny."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes. His actions are indeed suspicious."

Lucita Azaro

"Me too. There's good reason to believe they conspired with one another.

Titus Gordion

"Yes, of course. I didn't mean to offend."

Titus Gordion

"As Rizia's councilor on religion, he was a staunch advocate for the rights of individuals to follow their preferred religious beliefs."

Titus Gordion

"It's no secret that your father's hostility towards minority religions drew condemnation from various quarters, the Grand Wiseman among them."

Lucita Azaro

"Nothing definitive, but I'm confident that conducting further investigations will yield more conclusive information about him."

Titus Gordion

"Not yet, but I'm confident that conducting further investigations will yield more conclusive information about him."

Titus Gordion

"Having someone of his status go missing for such an extended duration indeed raises suspicions."

Titus Gordion

"He possesses knowledge of the palace's internal workings, which makes him a significant figure in my investigation."

Titus Gordion

"His access to the inner workings of the palace made him a person of interest. It was a detail that couldn't be overlooked."

Titus Gordion

"And with Pabel's grasp of the palace's internal workings, this took on added significance."

Titus Gordion

"In addition, there are other collaborating witnesses who can back me up."

Player_Romus

"Let's hear why you suspect Lucita."

Titus Gordion

"When I returned, I witnessed the Duchess exiting your father's chambers in great haste."

Player_Romus

"You're implying they were secret lovers or something?"

Player_Romus

"Well, what of it?"

Player_Romus

"What was she doing there?"

Player_Romus

"Don't leave me in suspense. Continue with your story."

Titus Gordion

"I would never suggest such a thing. However..."

Titus Gordion

"When we searched your father's chambers later, we found no such letter."

Player_Romus

"This is deeply troubling. What could Lucita be hiding?"

Player_Romus

"You know, your logic might not be so crazy after all. I always suspected that when it came to the throne, House Azaro was out for blood."

Titus Gordion

"My thoughts exactly."

Titus Gordion

"Yes. Anyway..."

Titus Gordion

"That's what concerned me."

Titus Gordion

"People can surprise us, for better or for worse. In any case..."

Titus Gordion

"That's a question I hope to find out."

Player_Romus

"Keep looking into Lucita's potential motivation. I think you might be onto something there."

Narrator

Alone once again, my thoughts returned to the investigation.

Lucita Azaro

"Trust can be a double-edged sword, and it's disheartening when it's broken."

Player_Romus

"Tell me what you've learned about my father's death."

Player_Romus

"Lucita. To what do I owe this pleasure?"

Player_Romus

"Yes? Something on your mind?"

Player_Romus

"Please, do tell. I'm eager to know what you've uncovered."

Lucita Azaro

"Only that I may have some information regarding your predecessor's demise."

Player_Romus

"Really? In that case, let's hear it."

Player_Romus

"Well, what are you waiting for? Spit it out."

Lucita Azaro

"'This pleasure' happens to be the information you requested about your father's death."

Narrator

And the city's distant lights shimmered, a testament to life continuing beyond the palace walls.

Narrator

His presence on the balcony hinted at an urgent matter, a reminder that, as a monarch, even moments of solitude could be fleeting.

Player_Romus

"To what do I owe the pleasure, Captain?"

Player_Romus

"Ah, it's you. Is something the matter?"

Player_Romus

"If you have something to report, make it quick."

Titus Gordion

"The one concerning His Majesty King Valero."

Titus Gordion

"I'm here to discuss that *personal matter* you asked me to look into."

Lucita Azaro

"I didn't think much of it until I stumbled across the name and address of a Dastnurist sanctuary handwritten on the inside cover of one such book."

Titus Gordion

"But it wasn't a Wruhecist service. It was a Dastnurist."

Titus Gordion

"The individual of which I speak is one of my most trusted guardsmen. They don't make mistakes."

Titus Gordion

"I understand how this news may be difficult to hear, especially since it contradicts the official state religion of Wruhecism. But..."

Player_Romus

"I guess Mother's still full of surprises. This should make for an interesting family conversation."

Titus Gordion

"...attending a Dastnurist religious service just outside the capital."

Player_Romus

"Okay, I'm listening..."

Lucita Azaro

"Brace yourself, but it turns out, she was attending a secret religious service just outside the capital."

Player_Romus

"Well, that's an interesting turn of events. Not what I expected to hear in the slightest. I assume you can verify the accuracy of this information?"

Lucita Azaro

"Which is precisely why I felt it was important for you to be informed right away."

Player_Romus

"I must admit I'm rather surprised by this revelation. If it were to become public knowledge, it could spark quite a scandal."

Titus Gordion

"One of my Golden Guards, who was assigned to protect her, confirmed it."

Titus Gordion

"The information is indeed accurate. The guardsman who accompanied her is among my most trustworthy subordinates."

Titus Gordion

"I understand how unsettling this might be, especially since this contradicts the official state religion of Wruhecism."

Player_Romus

"And how reliable is this Golden Guardsman of yours?"

Lucita Azaro

"No mistake. The information is solid."

Titus Gordion

"The individual of which I speak is very reliable."

Lucita Azaro

"The gathered information has undergone rigorous scrutiny. I wouldn't approach you with anything less."

Lucita Azaro

"I can only imagine."

Titus Gordion

"However, the information is reliable. The guardsman who was with her is one of my most dependable subordinates."

Player_Romus

"Good heavens... this is a lot to process. As a man of faith, forgive me when I say, I have a hard time relying solely on that... faith."

Titus Gordion

"Considering her upbringing in Zille, where Dastnurity is the prevailing religion, this revelation is quite understandable."

Player_Romus

"Well then, I guess there's no need to place mother in the royal dungeon. I suppose I'll have to find another suspect."

Player_Romus

"That is excellent news indeed! The plot thickens."

Player_Romus

"Hmm, so he won't be the star of our treasonous play after all. The plot thickens."

Player_Romus

"Why didn't you say so in the first place? This is very good news."

Lucita Azaro

"My apologies for the delay, Your Majesty."

Lucita Azaro

"Of course, Your Majesty. We're keeping our eyes on the unfolding drama."

Lucita Azaro

"Would you like to know the details of his whereabouts anyway?"

Player_Romus

"Yes, do tell."

Player_Romus

"Of course, let's hear it."

Lucita Azaro

"As previously mentioned, before Valero's death, there was a notable amount of time when we couldn't establish his whereabouts."

Titus Gordion

After extensive interviews with palace staff, it was determined that he spent that time in the wine cellar."

Player_Romus

"That old dog Good for him! Who was the lucky lady?"

Player_Romus

"What? That's insane. If my butler had a secret lover, I would know."

Player_Romus

"In the wine cellars? How very unprofessional -- not to mention, inappropriate. With whom was he engaged in this 'rendezvous?'"

Player_Romus

"In the wine cellar? With whom was he engaged in this 'rendezvous?'"

Player_Romus

"My faith guides me to condemn such actions. I'm highly disappointed in Pabel's behavior."

Player_Romus

"Wow. I'm highly disappointed in Pabel's behavior."

Player_Romus

"Pabel and I are old friends. I'll bring this up with him myself. No need to drag the law into it."

Lucita Azaro

"More like lucky gentleman, if you catch my meaning..."

Player_Romus

"Wait... You mean he was with a man? As in intimately?"

Lucita Azaro

"I have to confess, I had a feeling about Pabel since our trip to Qalus. I'm not surprised at all."

Titus Gordion

"We didn't turn up any conclusive evidence of what your butler and the courier were doing together. So this is all pure speculation."

Player_Romus

"Lets keep this information between us. Best to keep this from becoming public knowledge and causing a scandal."

Player_Romus

"Keep an eye on him. The last thing I need is my butler flaunting his criminal lifestyle in front of my nose."

Lucita Azaro

"I wont tell anyone. You have my word."

Lucita Azaro

"That's your prerogative."

Titus Gordion

"Certainly, sir."

Titus Gordion

"Very well, sir."

Player_Romus

"As long as it doesn't interfere with his duties, I dont see an issue. Let's stay focused on the task at hand, please."

Lucita Azaro

"A delivery person from Cantuavo vineyards who was dropping off casks of wine."

Lucita Azaro

"The alleged other individual in the equation was a delivery person from Cantuavo vineyards. They were dropping off casks of wine."

Player_Romus

"Well, Ill see to it that shes reported for her indiscretion. The Cantuavos should know about her irresponsible actions."

Player_Romus

"Her heedless and disrespectful actions should be conveyed to the Cantuavos."

Player_Romus

"She should be fired, immediately."

Lucita Azaro

"Not 'she.'"

Lucita Azaro

"He."

Narrator

It took me a moment before the implications hit me.

Narrator

I shot my eyebrows up in feigned surprise.

Player_Romus

"As long as Pabel didn't kill my father, I don't care what he was doing that night."

Player_Romus

"Oh, I see what you're getting at now."

Player_Romus

"Well, this just keeps getting better and better."

Player_Romus

"Ah. I see now."

Narrator

I raised my eyebrows in astonishment.

Lucita Azaro

"If this assignation occurred, it was with a courier from the Cantuavo vineyards."

Lucita Azaro

"It was supposedly a man, by the way. A courier from the Cantuavo vineyards."

Titus Gordion

"You might be surprised to know that it was a man. A courier from the Cantuavo vineyards."

Player_Romus

"As in, with a man? That's disgusting."

Player_Romus

"Do you intend to present verifiable evidence connecting Sal to the crime? Because as of now, your argument seems quite unsubstantiated."

Lucita Azaro

"In fact, Captain Gordion wasn't there at all. Nobody knows where he was."

Titus Gordion

"As is my duty, I was there that night overseeing your father's security. However, I had temporarily left my post to attend to a personal matter, leaving one of my guardsmen in charge."

Titus Gordion

"Her actions raise questions about the events leading to your father's passing. I believe we should investigate this further, discreetly and meticulously."

Titus Gordion

"I can't attest to that. I'm only presenting what I've been able to gather."

Player_Romus

"Well, come on. Spit it out. What was she doing there?"

Titus Gordion

"That's what I've been trying to discern."

Player_Romus

"I do hope you're not suggesting they were doing something... impure."

Player_Romus

"Well, that's one way to make an exit."

Player_Romus

"So you left your post during your duty? Not the best way to start your case."

Titus Gordion

"I suspect she may have been carrying a letter, but I cannot confirm its contents, recipient, or sender."

Player_Romus

"Sounds like a lot of speculation and no sustenance, if you asked me."

Titus Gordion

"I had my suspicions that she might have been carrying letters, but I couldn't ascertain the sender, the recipients, or the contents."

Player_Romus

"Sounds like a lot of speculation and no sustenance, if you asked me. I'm honestly disappointed this is all you can give me on Lucita."

Player_Romus

"Good heavens, this is deeply troubling. I wonder what Lucita could be hiding."

Narrator

On the palace balcony, I sought refuge from the relentless affairs of the state.

Narrator

Amid this tranquil backdrop, I found a brief respite from the responsibilities that weighed on my shoulders.

Narrator

It was during this peaceful interlude that Lucita approached.

Narrator

The only question was whether she was here for an urgent matter or...

Narrator

Business only, it seemed.

Titus Gordion

"No. Nothing's the matter."

Titus Gordion

"It would be my pleasure."

Titus Gordion

"I apologize if I startled you."

Narrator

I took no pleasure in investigating a member of my own family, it had to be done.

Lucita Azaro

"A few of these individuals now strike me as particularly suspicious."

Titus Gordion

"A few of these individuals now strike me as particularly suspicious."

Player_Romus

"I have doubts about your conclusions on the Grand Wiseman. Nevertheless, I'll keep an open mind."

Lucita Azaro

Some suspect him of having a secret rendezvous."

Titus Gordion

Some suspect him of having a secret rendezvous."

Lucita Azaro

"This was months before your coronation. And the alleged other party hasn't returned to the palace since."

Titus Gordion

"This was months before your coronation. And the alleged other party hasn't returned to the palace since."

Lucita Azaro

"The alleged other party was a delivery man from the Cantuavo vineyards."

Lucita Azaro

"I have to confess, I'm not surprised. Your butler is too dapper for his own good."

Narrator

He eyed me closely.

Lucita Azaro

"With that said... we were unable to turn up any conclusive evidence of what he and the courier were doing in the cellar. It's all pure speculation."

Player_Romus

"Not in the castle? Well, if she wasn't there, then where was she?"

Player_Romus

"I guess Mother's still full of surprises."

Titus Gordion

"Speaking of surprises, you'll be pleased to know where we found out where she really was..."

Player_Romus

"You're kidding, right?"

Player_Romus

"A Dastnurist service? How can this be?"

Player_Romus

"A part of me hopes this information is inaccurate."

Titus Gordion

"I understand how unsettling this might be."

Titus Gordion

"My initial list of suspects comprised four individuals. Lucita Azaro, Grand Wiseman Ignacius, your uncle, and your mother."
